crew/astrid-alder.html.title: Astrid Alder
crew/astrid-alder.html.description:
Info Pronouns:: She/Her Location:: USS Hudson-B Type:: Supporting Character Status:: Commissioned NumRank:: 1 Rank:: Captain Species:: Human Role:: Commanding Officer
Portrait:: Note:: Sent to the Shackleton Expanse to act as a bridge builder to new peoples and civilizations. She carefully chose her crew for this purpose. Astrid Alder built a reputation in Starfleet as a First Contact specialist. She is a remarkable ability to keep contact open with new civilization and build bridges between them and the Federation.
Now, Captain Alder is assigned to the USS Hudson-B to form new alliances far away on the far side of the Klingon and Romulan empires, in the Shackleton Expanse. For this mission, she has hand picked members of her crew to handle a wide variety of scientific, military, and diplomatic situations.
Captain Alder coached Verid Tiaun through a tense negotiation between a Federation colony and a Tzenkethi colony.
Robert H. Lodge is the XO and reports directly to Alder. Table7 resultsSort1Filter1PropertiesNewFjFjFjFjFj

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 1.1 - Arrival at Bacchus-3
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-1.description:
You can join one of my Mothership one shots for free! This month's One Shot Special is Mothership! A Mothership One Shot *100 years ago, the American Oil and Fuel Corporation bankrupted itself to send a doomed space mission to the planet Mercury. A century later, deep surface scans show an impossible petroleum compound hidden under the crust of Mercury, dubbed "dragobenzine". You have been hired to survey and break ground on a new mining operation that promises to unlock interstellar travel for humanity using this new fuel source. This historic return to the Scorched Planet will also answer a century old mystery: Why did the oil and fuel corp throw everything away to get here, and why did they never return?* Content advisory! Fire, Mutilation, Body Horror, Character Death, Death, Demons, Mind alteration, Self-Harm, Violence, Cults These one shot specials are FREE for any player in an active ongoing campaign. Others can join at the listed price. You can also always invite a friend and give them your referral code and you BOTH get $10 credit on SPG.
The USS Hudson-A arrived at Bacchus-3, falling victim to a total power failure tripped by a massive subspace distortion. The subspace waves prevent long range communication and warp travel. They were found to be originated on Bacchus-3. An away team was put together to investigate the planet and hopefully deactivate whatever is causing the waves. On the planet, several Federation members were found, studying massive monoliths reaching into the upper atmosphere. The Hudson's away team was able to open a door on the monolith, revealing passageways inside.

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 1.2 - Bacchus' Irresistible Call
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-1.description: The Hudson's away team managed to deactivate the subspace distortion wave using the control room inside one of Bacchus' spires. Meanwhile, a Klingon Bird of Prey, The IKR Ya'Leth, fell out of warp completely deactivated much like the Hudson before.Deactivating the subspace wave triggers a security response, and the machinery in the planet began to rip apart the other planets in the solar system. The Hudson's crew assisted the Ya'Leth to eject their warp core, now resonating with the same subspace distortions as the planet.After escaping the Bacchus system, astronomers watched in horror and amazement as the entire Bacchus-3 system pulled itself apart, pulling inwards towards a singularity, and disappeared.

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-2.title: Hudson Log 2 - Orion Heist
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-2.description: Admiral Banna Stoker sent the crew of the USS Hudson to recover a stolen Tilikaal artifact. The crew tracked the artifact down to the SS Tardigrade, an Orion trade ship, and convinced them to hand over the artifact before their Romulan liaison arrived. Back on Narendra Station, Admiral Stoker took the artifact to study further.

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-3.title: Hudson Log 3 - Phantoms Adrift
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-3.description: While delivering an encrypted message from Captain Alder to Captain Skaarsen, a trusted friend of Alder's, Commander Lodge and Lieutenant Tiaun encountered an 50 year old derelict Starfleet starship drifting out of on ion Nebula.There, an unknown species attempted to escape the wreckage by disguising themselves as copies of Lodge and Tiaun. The two real officers escaped the derelict ship and delivered the message, leaving a report with Starfleet to take care of the derelict ship and the strange entities there.

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-4.title: Hudson Log 4.1 - The Pasqual Problem
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-4.description: While preparing to perform a deep space scan of the Shackleton Expanse, the Hudson encountered a starfleet shuttle with Admiral Bana Stoker on board. Stoker ordered the Hudson to head directly towards the Pasqual system, which had previously been unscanned. There, an away team was sent to investigate Pasqual-1, an M-class planet with a thick electromagnetic field surrounding it.The planet was inhabited by a variety of intelligent humanoid people that appear to be of many different species, but without any sort of advanced technology. The away team, led by Commander Lodge and joined by Jolepo, Verid, Doctor Suvak, and Ensign Tak avoided contact with the locals. They got beamed off the planet after 24 hours with film photographs and recorded observations.

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-4.title: Hudson Log 4.2 - The Pasqual Problem
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-4.description:
Please make an account on The Forge (link in discord channel). Let me know if you have any difficulties with the new tools! Try rolling on a couple character sheets and the ship Look in the "Journals" tab in the top right. Check out the mission logs format and some of the other notes. Find your character token on the ship rooms page and try moving them around a bit! Test out some of the macros. There's a couple techobabble macros and one for using the "fire" action in ship combat! I feel the following supporting characters are eligible for advancement! If I've forgotten someone who deserves it, please nominate them! Tak - @ Kelly
Roger Quincy @ John
Astrid Alder @ Dan
Kyle Miller @ Jeff Each of these characters can do one of the following (take note of which one you choose): Add a new Value (up to four times) Increase an attribute by 1 (one time only) Increase a department by 1 (one time only) Add a new focus (up to three times) Add a new Talent (up to four times) Supporting Character advancement is on page 146 (also below). Supporting characters can also be advanced further using your Milestones.
The Hudson was attacked by a Klingon D7 battle cruiser, which demanded custody of Admiral Stoker. The Hudson barely managed to avoid any serious harm before disabling the Klingon ship. Captain Astrid Alder attempted to liaison with the Klingons, but they demanded death in combat and would not surrender. Commander Lodge and Doctor Suvok convinced the Klingon Captain to let them on board to tend to their wounded, based on giving the Klingons a fair fight.Back on the Hudson, Lt. Cmdr. Jolepo and Lt. Verid refitted an atmospheric probe to enter the electromagnetic field of Pasqual-1. While performing a sensor sweep of the obelisk there, the probe was uploaded with thousands of years of genetic survey results. Each survey was paired was an "genetic advancement attempt", the results and purpose of which are still unclear.

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-5.title: Hudson Log 5 - Aboard the Klingon Ship
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-5.description: Sukav, Robert Lodge, Valerie, and Tak beamed aboard the IKR Ya'leth on the pretense of offering medical aid. Their real mission was to figure out what the Klingons wanted with Admiral Stoker. The Klingon crew members seemed to be as irritated and confused about the situation as the crew of the Hudson. Their captain had kept the purpose of their mission secret, much like Admiral Stoker. However, the captain of the Klingon ship was soon forced to admit he and Stoker were after a weapon of incredible power. As the Klingon Crew mutinied, the Hudson away team left to confront Stoker. The Admiral ordered the Hudson to destroy the Klingon ship, but captain Astrid Alder had Stoker arrested instead.
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-5.sourcePath: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Hudson/Shared/Sessions/Summaries/Season 1/Hudson Log 5 - Aboard the Klingon Ship.md

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-6.title: Hudson Log 6 - Border Dispute
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-6.description: The USS Hudson was summoned to rescue the USS Nightingale, a Federation science vessel which had drifted unexpectedly into the neutral zone. There, a Romulan bird of prey was claiming the crewmembers as prisoners of war. The Hudson quickly engaged the Romulan warbird and nearly disabled it while an evacuation team attempted to get survivors off the Nightingale. In the end, a Romulan disguised as a Vulcan, named T'lek attempted to return to the bird of prey but was fired upon. When T'lek sought refuge on the Hudson, they were quickly found to be a spy and arrested. It's still unclear what information T'lek was trying to give to the Romulans.

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-7.title: Hudson Log 7 - Investigation
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-7.description: With the Hudson docked for the duration of Admiral Banna Stoker's court martial trial, the crew took some time to collect information on the Tilikaal artifact and the effect it may have had the admiral. In the end, they found a subliminal message of mental domination embedded in the artifact's subspace distress signal. Meanwhile, Commander Lodge followed leads of civilian trade of Tilikaal artifacts and opened civilian passage to systems previously blocked by Admiral Stoker.

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-8.title: Hudson Log 8 - Court Martial
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-8.description: Ahead of the trial, Jolepo and Verid investigated some of Admiral Stoker's history on the station, in particular the discharge of her son, Avery, a science officer aboard Narendra Station. They discovered that Admiral Stoker had suspected a Starfleet coverup regarding the Tilikaal and used her position to conduct a private investigation into the Subspace frequencies in the Washboard and their origin.Lodge argued through witness testimony that the Admiral had acted recklessly with her authority, and her removal from command was necessary to avoid prime directive violation and potential flashpoints leading to war with the Klingons. Cogley argued that the Admiral had acted within her rights in the chain of command and according to Starfleet values to provide assistance to a people in need.Finally, when Lodge offered into evidence the fact that Stoker may have been telepathically manipulated through the Tilikaal artifact, the tribunal ruled to acquit Stoker of charges, but reassigned her to a position far away from the Shackleton Expanse where her condition can be monitored.

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-9.title: Hudson Log 9 - Convention
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-9.description: Science Officer Kassandra Pruitt went missing while investigating some of the system survey data recovered from T'Lek. Since Starfleet suspected Romulan involvement, Starfleet organized a convention to lure Pruitt's abductors. The bait would be several more Starfleet officers with connections to T'Lek and Admiral Stoker from the USS Hudson.The Delegations from the Romulans, Klingons, Orions, and many Federation worlds were invited to demonstrate their scientific and technological advancements. The members of the Hudson followed several leads, including a few Orions and a Klingon thief.A human trader named Cyrano Jones was peddling a Tilikaal dagger at the convention, and caught he attention of a Romulan Sub-Commander named Thalvaek, and a couple Orions. However, Jolepo was able to buy the dagger from Jones first. This lead to a Romulan named Sarren to attempted kidnapping Jolepo, but was unsuccessful.In a gambit to find out more of the the Romulan plans and form a stronger relationship, Sukav met with subcommander Thal'vaek with an offer to sell a Tilikaal dagger. He was not seen at the convention again, but was given a tracking device that saw him brought into the Romulan Empire.

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 10.1 - Abyss Station
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-1.description: After a week of watching Sukav's tracking device linger in Romulan space, he was suddenly moved past Narendra station and into the Shackleton Expanse. The Hudson gave chase, pushing it's warp nacelles to ride over the washboard effect and catch up to the Romulan bird of prey.They found the bird of prey at a system orbiting a black hole, dubbed the Omega Draconis system. There, they found single rocky planet with no atmosphere but a series of underground structures about approximately 300 life signs. There was also a large space station made of obsidian black neutronium. The Romulans had taken Sukav, Lt Pruitt, and two Starfleet ensign s into the alien space station.As the Hudson arrived, the black hole suddenly seemed to rotate. Massive high powered radiation jets moved to expel along the galactic plane. The planet, and all ~300 people on it, stood to be annihilated. One away team went down to the planet to start an evacuation, while another went into the space station to recover Sukav and hopefully find out what caused the block hole to change orientation.The team on the planet found a small group of pale humanoids with space travel capabilities but no warp capability. They spoke about how they had spent a very long gazing into the abyss waiting for the time when the abyss would gaze back at them. They seemed unconcerned about the radiation jets.Meanwhile, a rescue team infiltrated the alien space station. Inside, they found large and humanoid-shaped automatons and a series of passageways leading into the center of the station. At the center, they found the Romulans working in a control center and the Starfleet officers tied up in the middle of the room. The rescue team ambushed the Romulans and engaged in the firefight. Kyle Miller and Tizia were each wounded by disruptor fire, leaving only Verid to fend off the remaining 5 Romulans.

sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 10.2 - Abyss Station Part 2
sessions/summaries/season-1/hudson-log-1.description: On the planet, Nisha spoke to the colony's leader, Akkara and attempted to convince them to evacuate the planet. Tak quickly collected as much about this people as they could, to preserve the historical record. Although Nisha was able to provide ample evidence that the planet and everyone on it would be destroyed, Akkara's faith that the Abyss would spare them was too great. In the end, the black hole's radiation jets obliterated the planet after the Hudson's crew evacuated.Meanwhile, Verid, Sukav, Astrid, and Kyle Miller dispatched the Romulans. Astrid sustained severe disruptor burns but Sukav stabilized her. Verid and Sukav worked together to operate the station, which seemed to be controlling the black hole. The controls implied the black hole was capable of generating a wormhole, through with the black hole itself or the radiation jets would be able to annihilate anything at the coordinates. The Romulans had set the coordinates at the Klingon homeworld, Qo'Nos.Ultimately, Verid and Sukav resolved that the station had to be destroyed so that the Romulans, nor even the Federation, could return to it. Without a way to communicate with the Hudson, they stayed behind and used the controls to create a singularity inside the station itself. The new singularity engulphed the station, Verid, and Sukav.

sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 11 - Crystal Clear
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.description: After Abyss Station was destroyed by a new singularity, the USS Hudson left the Omega Draconis system towards Narendra station. The Hudson held a vigil for the lost members of the crew, Verid and Sukav. On the way back to Narendra Station, they found the stars and systems around them had moved much further in time than anticipated, about 110 years.On the way back, the Hudson encountered a strange crystalline ship attempting to communicate through light. An away team with Robert Lodge, Jolepo, Tizia, and Nisha beamed aboard the starship. They found a crystalline species, who led them to a unidentified torpedo embedded into the crystal walls of the ship.The torpedo was still active, and the attempts to remove it went awry. Jolepo and Tizia evacuated out into space through a hole in the hull, while Robert and Nisha took cover behind a door. A large section of the starship shattered like glass, and it fled soon afterwards.The Hudson continued to Narendra station, where they found that much had changed. The alliance between the Federation had strengthened, but not without some strife. General Kargan was still in command of the station, now approaching almost 200 years old. He had limited and controlled exploration of the Shackleton Expanse over the last 100 years, fearing the fate of his old counterpart, Banna Stoker. Now, a new Admiral joined Kargan from the Federation: Admiral April Hebert.After welcoming the crew of the Hudson back to Narendra Station, April invited them to take some time off to find their new place in the world. Robert Lodge would go on to become a historian, looking into the events of the past 100 years. And Astrid Alder would take some time off to consider new options in Starfleet. In the meantime, Narendra Station would provide an interim commanding officer and supplementary crew along with a Galaxy Class starship named in the Hudson's honor.

sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 12 - Pasqual's Progress
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.description: Captain Edward Scriba took several members of the new USS Hudson-B on a short survey mission aboard the Hudson's yacht. They visited Pasqual-1, and found the society there advancing rapidly though technological ages on their own. The people of Pasqual had embark on a century long project to go to space. An away team found a single neutronium obelisk left on the planet, which seemed to have some sort of influence on the people there.Captain Edward Scriba took several members of the USS Hudson on a survey mission aboard the captain's yacht, the USS Portland. They planned to visit Pasqual-1 on a routine survey mission, and follow that up with a visit to the Lilifas system.They found that the Pasqual-1 population had been speed-running their technological advancement. In just 110 years, they've reached the equivalent of earth's information age (already a time known for accelerated advances in technology.) After Jolepo expressed interest in visiting the planet, Captain Scriba agreed. Scriba, Jolepo, Jaro, and Delisle all went down, leaving Nisha and Tizia on the yacht.On the planet, the away team found a society with a singular focus: get into space. The people there had correctly deduced that the monoliths Starfleet removed we taken from them, and their entire culture had been driven to reach out to know what else was out there.The away team decided to find something like a library, and got directions to something the people there called repository. People there seemed to expect the away team to speak openly and constantly about what new projects and research they were working on. At the repository, the away team sought out information on the black neutronium monoliths that were removed from the planet over the last 100 years. What they found was a history of people quicky devising that someone from off world must have taken the obelisks, and that space-travel must be possible.In the repository, a weekly ideas-sharing session was held, where all in attendance were required to share their research and progress. In the middle of this atrium, a silo opened up, and one of the black monoliths rose up from below. Lieutenant Delisle felt a presence of malicious patience coming from within the silo. Jolepo scanned the area during the meeting and found a subspace signal with a some sort of sublimal messaging in it, similar to the artifact that influenced Admiral Banna Stoker 110 years ago.Jolepo presented on an energy-efficient waste-disposal system for a colony ship, which avoided any suspicion that they may be from off world. Once the meeting was over, the away team was able to find a place to be alone and beam off planet unnoticed.Before reporting back to Starfleet, the crew of the USS Portland also visited the second planet on their itinerary: Lilifas. Here, they did a survey on the pre-warp civilization below. Video footage revealed a species of centaur-like otter people with age-of-sail technology. While observing Lilifas, a tractor beam from the planet grabbed asteroid orbiting in a ring around the planet, and threw it towards the USS Portland. Lt. Nisha was able to dodge the rocks. The USS Portland then returned to Narendra station, with plans to recover the 1 monolith remaining on Pasqual-1.

sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 13.1 - Pasqual's Past
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.description: Back on Narendra Station, Admiral Hebert and General Kargan met with the bridge crew of the USS Hudson to discuss what to do about the civilization on the Pasqual system. They decided, much to General Kargan's dismay, that the Federation would make first contact with the Pasqualese. Captain Scriba made this contact by connecting to the planet's global communications network and announcing the Hudson's presence and intentions of peace. The planet's activity spiked there was a frenzy of communications on the planet. But before long, the Pasquallese sent a delegation to meet with the crew of the Hudson.The delegation was amazed by Starfleet technology, particularly interested in their warp technology, transporters, and replicators. After introductions were made, Captain Scriba made arrangements to start sharing Federation technology with them as a gesture of peace.The Hudson stayed at the Pasqual system for an extended time, and the crew spent plenty of time on and around the planet communicating with an teaching the Pasqualese about what it's like to be in the Federation. Delisle in particular learned that the Pasqualese depended on their biological distinctiveness and diversity to surive, each person contributing to the whole. This led to a culture that strongly valued cooperation and sharing.Delisle also picked up aa constant feeling of anxiety from the people of Pasqual-1. As if they weren't telling the Hudson and crew everything.Meanwhile, Jaro was lead below the obelisk and met a borg queen, and told to repair the transwarp drive. There, he came face to face with some sort of Borg head in a jar. It awoke and said, "Greetings."

sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 13.2 - The Proto-Borg
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.description: Below the repository, Jaro spoke with the Borg, learning that it had arrived thousands of years ago and was forced to remain dormant while the planet's electromagnetic field was active. But in the past 100 years, it had awoken and was using the Tilikaal monolith to influence and guide to people of Pasqual-1.The Borg "Queen" talked about being a creation of the Tilikaal, and that its mission was to travel the stars in search of them. It claimed that once it found the Tilikaal, perfect beings, it could finally assimilate them to become as perfect as they are.After a great deal of debate and further investiation the Hudson's crew decided to kill the Borg queen. But the Borg queen controlled the assimilated skeletons left over in the small Borg ship and defended herself. When the last of the guard were neutralized, the Borg queen begged for it's life. But Jolepo executed it.Starfleet and a compliment of Klingon battleships arrived on Pasqual and occupied it. There was a full sweep of the planet and find and root out and Borg technology. It took weeks. The Tilikaal monolith was excavated and removed from the planet also.While the people of Pasqual-1 now had a great leap in technology, they were left with a disdain for the Federation.

sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 14 - The Qofuari Conundrum
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.description: The Hudson responded to a distress call from a Pre-Warp at the Lilifas system. They got in touch with a group of local Qofuari calling themselves the Future Builders. They claimed they were being held captive on their planet because development of advanced technology was illegal, despite their ability to do so.The Hudson got in touch with the planet's local authorities and spent time learning about the Qofuari and their culture. They were a fairly tribal people, but had managed to enforce this law globally due to matching cultural values. The Qofuari had also been evolved from Tilikaal monoliths similar to the Pasqualese, but at some point had managed to disassemble the monoliths themselves. The existence of the monoliths seemed to have been impetus for the laws against technology in the first place.In the end, the Hudson agreed to take aboard the Future builders and bring them back to Narendra Station, taking them away from their home planet.

sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 15 - Fading Sun
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.description: The Hudson was assigned to deliver scientific equipment the small Epsilon 19 starbase at the Osarin system. The Starbase was studying a fading star, where the energy seemed to be disappearing. While aboard the station, Captain Scriba, Jolepo, and Doctor T'Lor got dinner with the station's commanding officer, Commander Johansson. At dinner, they met an Orion woman named Helestia Baenor, who had brought a number of luxuries to the station as gifts to thank the officers for allowing her crew to rest at the station. Meanwhile, the Hudson left to go study the nearby star.After getting a tour of the station, Scriba, Jolepo, and T'Lor were aboard a turbolift with station science officer Mosa, when the station suffered a massive explosion at several points. T'Lor was able to stabilize Mosa, and they all climbed the turbolift shaft to a medical bay. There, they discovered the source of triolic radiation emanating from the engineering section, the same radiation emanating from the nearby star.In engineering, they discovered Baenor had turned off power output to the rest of the station, which had inadvertently lead to the explosion. Scriba left to pursue and arrest her. On the station's nuclear fusion reactor, Jolepo found strange energy parasite creatures out of phase in time. He used his phaser to bring them back into phase and caught several of them, but others escaped into Jefferies Tubes. By this point, power was restored to the station, and security teams could be organized to hunt down these strange creatures. The station would later be given better shielding to prevent infection from the local start, where the Hudson had discovered the parasites breeding.Helestia Baenor was arrested and found with Starfleet science equipment aboard her ship. She claimed to be attempting to rescue the equipment and prevent it from becoming damaged in the exploding starbase. She would be brought to Narendra Station for trial.

sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 16.1 - Convoy SE-119
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.description: Both the Mupwl' and Hudson were in Narendra station undergoing minor refits, repairs, and maintenance. Captain Akul asked captain to help convince Kargan to approve a colonization effort in the Shackleton expanse. The Hudson would provide cover for the convpy along with Akkara's IKS Mupwl'. Kargan reluctantly agreed.Along the way, the convoy headed through a region of the Expanse with strange subspace eddies in the washboard. Unlike the usual background turbulence of the washboard subspace waves.In these eddies, the Mupwl' suffered a sudden explosion in one of their warp nacelles, and comms were disrupted by the eddies as well. While the Hudson tried to make contact and organize repair teams, two unidentified ships with sails and masts appeared on the sensors, seemingly being "behind" the subspace eddies.The unidentified ships demanded the Hudson and Mupwl' had over their warp cores because "Power is our right." and attacked soon after. On the viewscreen, the enemies identified themselves as Vinshari and had bright red skin, with collar bones that rose out of the skin and flanked their necks like cape collars.The Hudson positioned itself to protect the convoy ships, and the Vinshari ships deployed a dozen small single fighters. Commander Jaro as able to modulate the Hudson's shields to crush half the fighters in a subspace eddy, which also collapsed the eddy itself.One of the larger Vinshari ships attacked the disabled Mupwl' and another tried to deal with the Hudson, while the remaining small fighters maneuvered to intercept the freighters. The Vinshari ships had difficulty piercing the Hudson's shields with their physical ammunition. And have since maneuvered around them to focus on the freighters.

sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 16.2 - Prisoner
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.description: The Hudson, the Klingon Mupwl' and their convoy of colonization ships had been ambushed by pirates calling themselves Vinshari. They used harpoons to to try and grab a convoy freighter, but the Hudson cut the lines using it's phasers.The Hudson scared away the two remaining Vinshari ships. They used some kind of unknown warp technology that did not show up on Federation sensors. Seemingly, it used the washboard in the Shackleton Expanse to efficiently shape subspace bubbles.In the wreckage of the battle, the Hudson found a damaged Vinshari fighter with a single pilot. The shuttle was beamed into a shuttle bay, and the pilot into the brig.Ozym interrogated the prisoner, named MianNo-Ar, who said they were looking to reclaim energy, and that it is their right. He said something about hunting rights and that there must be a great number of Ha'kiv on board Hudson to produce such a large energy signature.The bridge crew of the Hudson later met in the briefing room, and made a plan for what to do with the prisoner. Delisle followed up on other leads they knew of from the Vinshari, specifically translating some of the messages from the crystalline ship 100 years ago. Some progress was made in modelling the internal crystal structure that might process the language.Ozym recovered intel from the Vinshari ship computers and revealed a solar system deeper in the expanse with 3 suns and 11 planets, seemingly a hot spot for Vinshari traffic. It also showed a complex chain of command with a high level of independence for each star ship. MianNo-Ar owned his own starship for example.Fitz and T'Lor worked on repairing the Vinshari ship so that the pilot could go home. This was done by finding a bio-electric blood substance in the ship's power cell. Most of the cells were dead, but T'Lor was able to rejuvenate them.Finally, Captain Scriba spoke to the pilot and asked him to bring a message of peace back to his people. Delisle also managed to ask for a blood sample for study purposes, suspecting Tilikaal influence on the Vinshari people. MianNo-Ar was able to confirm that his home planet had black obelisks on it, at least. MianNo-Ar agreed to carry the message of peace, and was sent back home safely.

sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 17.1 - Decision Point
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.description: The USS Hudson was dispatched to the Shackleton Expanse after Starfleet detected three synchronized signals hidden within the region’s subspace “washboard” noise. These signatures matched Tilikaal technology previously encountered on Bacchus III and Pasqual I, leading Admiral Hebert and General Kargan to brief the crew at Narendra Station before deployment. The Hudson traced one of the signals to the Orgun system, where they discovered two inhabited worlds—one of which faced catastrophic geological collapse.Upon arrival, they encountered a civilian Klingon vessel assisting in evacuations while the Hudson’s sensors revealed massive tectonic instability tearing the planet apart. The away team descended deep into the planet’s crust, navigating lava flows and collapsing tunnels until they discovered a buried Tilikaal terraforming control facility. The technology had been damaged by a rockfall, causing the systems to spiral out of control and destabilize the planet’s surface.The crew interfaced their tricorders with the alien systems, translating enough data to disable the malfunctioning machinery and halt the immediate tectonic upheaval. Although the Hudson bought the inhabitants precious time, atmospheric damage from released gases will soon trigger a global ice age. Starfleet now has weeks instead of days to organize a complete evacuation.The other planet, Orgun 2, had a separate pre-warp civilization on it, much less advanced than the people on Orgun-3. The Klingon captain and the Lormeans wanted to evacuate to Orgun-2, but First Officer Asha Vornar had reservations about this plan, being conscious about the potential affects of occupation.

sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 17.2 - No Place Like Home
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.description: Following the events on Orgun III, the USS Hudson continued efforts to evacuate the planet’s population after halting the runaway Tilikaal terraforming systems. While the immediate tectonic collapse had been stopped, the atmospheric damage was severe enough that a permanent evacuation was necessary. The crew debated relocating Orgun III’s inhabitants to nearby Orgun II, but cultural contamination risks under the Prime Directive.An away team surveyed Orgun II and discovered large subterranean cave systems where the Orgun III refugees could survive temporarily, but conditions were far from ideal. Meanwhile, a science team scouted relocation options and identified two candidate worlds: a habitable planet several weeks away or a marginal “Type K” world only a day’s journey from Orgun. Given the urgency, the Hudson chose the closer planet despite its barren, Mars-like conditions requiring domed habitats for survival.Back on Orgun III, an engineering team repurposed Tilikaal technology to stabilize the planet’s environment. Using tractor-beam systems buried deep beneath the surface, they adjusted the planet’s orbit slightly to counter the onset of an ice age and began atmospheric remediation. Though full recovery will take time, Orgun III’s inhabitants now have a safe temporary home while their world is slowly restored.
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.sourcePath: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Hudson/Shared/Sessions/Summaries/Season 2/Hudson Log 17.2 - No Place Like Home.md

sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.title: Hudson Log 19 - New Life and New Civilizations
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.description: After stabilizing Orgun III, the USS Hudson set course toward the second of three Tilikaal signal sources but diverted to investigate a distress call in the Amaddon system. Instead of a damaged vessel, they discovered enormous, pearlescent lifeform (later identified as Ha’kiv) drifting near a gas giant and emitting harmonic subspace signals.Before the Hudson could investigate further, several Vinshari ships warped in and harpooned the two Ha’kiv, preparing to drain their energy. The Vinshari then opened fire on the Hudson, forcing the crew into a desperate engagement. Outnumbered and outgunned, the Hudson was heavily damaged and ultimately forced to retreat.During their escape, they were pursued by a Vinshari shuttle belonging to the Ar-Ka-Se, a splinter faction opposed to exploiting Ha’kiv. Aboard, Captain J’Lara appealed for Starfleet’s help in rescuing a captured Ha’kiv, revealing that the Vinshari harvest these beings as living power sources and have hunted them nearly to extinction. Since the Ha'kiv were nearly all hunted to extinction, she believed that releasing just this one adult could result in the Vinshari considering other energy alternatives. Her science officer, Thacinn, was revealed to be a Tilikaal survivor with fragmented memories of captivity and experimentation.Though the Hudson declined direct involvement due to Prime Directive concerns, and the possibility of starting a future war. They instead offered technical assistance to help refit J’Lara’s ship for warp travel using a matter-antimatter engine. J’Lara didn't want to waste time and instead resolved to attempt the rescue of the Ha'kiv alone.
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-1.sourcePath: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Hudson/Shared/Sessions/Summaries/Season 2/Hudson Log 19 - New Life and New Civilizations.md

sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-2.title: Hudson Log 20.1 - Signals
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-2.description: After leaving the Amaddon system and a refusing to aid Captain J'Lara, the USS Hudson went to the Seku system, the second of three sites emitting signals similar to those at Bacchus-3 and Pasqual-1. There, they found a water-covered planet with an electromagnetic field, preventing transporter use and masking surface scans. An Aqua Shuttle was launched to investigate.The away team was led by Asha Vornar and included Maui, Cendek, Tizia, and Gray. They entered the planet’s atmosphere, but ionization disabled the shuttle’s thrusters. Gray managed a hard landing on the ocean surface.The team drove the aqua shuttle deeper into the ocean. Soon after, the crew received a message warning them to leave, followed by a plasma bolt that disabled the aquashuttle. After crashing the shuttle on the sea floor, They located a submerged cave system, where they discovered the wreckage of a Klingon shuttle. They decided not to go further into the cave, and returned to the Aqua Shuttle to boost their communications to the Hudson. Transport was still impossible due to interference.A submersible shuttle found them, piloted by a woman named Noralith, who looked much like a Vulcan or a Romulan. She claimed escape was impossible but offered to bring them to a sanctuary. Inside a massive underwater dome, the crew discovered an ancient city of ruins sustained by a large crystal. The crystal projected a beam that created a force field dome that kept the ocean at bay. No one fully understood the crystal’s operation, but disturbing it could collapse the dome entirely.The city housed survivors from multiple species, including Vinshari, Qofuari, and Noralith’s own people, the Akaru. They were a Vulcanoid species unaware of any history with the Vulcans or Romulans.While Asha searched the submersibles for usable communication tech, Tizia and Gray investigated the temple with the crystal. They translated Tilikaal inscriptions that described a project to create “perfect beings” formed from crystal.Meanwhile, the USS Hudson in orbit received a distress call from captain J'Lara. Something had gone wrong with their attempt to rescue the Ha'kiv and a star had gone supernova. Captain Scriba ordered the Hudson to separate its saucer section, and the Battle Bridge was manned to stage the rescue mission.

sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-2.title: Hudson Log 20.2 - Atlantis
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-2.description: The Hudson's away team was still trapped in the underwater ruined city on Seku-4. There, Asha Vornar learned to pilot the refugees' patched-together submersibles and worked with Cendek to repair their long range communications array. After a rough piloting test, Asha and Cendek successfully boosted the comms array, giving it enough power to attempt contact with the Hudson.Meanwhile, Maui and Tizia investigated the Tilikaal temple at the center of the city. Maui, swimming beneath the structure, discovered hundreds of crystal formations on the sea floor. They were likely the remains of the same crystal species encountered before. Tizia translated more Tilikaal writings, which referred to the species as Cal-Mirrans and described their ability to emit tachyon radiation and perform something called “time refraction.”Cendek later spoke with Noralith, the Akaru leader of the settlement. She reflected on how her time here had changed her—learning to value survival and coexistence over Akaru ideals of pure efficiency. Though she doubted they could ever leave, she encouraged Cendek to find peace in the settlement.Later, Maui followed the currents through the caves and returned to the wrecked Klingon shuttle, then deeper into another chamber containing a Vinshari vessel with Ha’kiv sails. The cave turned out to be the maw of a massive sea creature. Maui escaped using his phaser and was rescued by the others in a submersible. Along with him came debris from the Ha’kiv sails, enough to possibly break through the planet’s electromagnetic field.

sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-2.title: Hudson Log 20.3 - City in the Sky
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-2.description: After Maui’s rescue, the team returned to the submerged city on Seku-4 with recovered Vinshari Ha'kiv sails. While some settlers remained uneasy about tampering with the Tilikaal crystal, others were growing more curious. A theory began to spread that the crystal might be sentient or at least partially alive.Cendek, Asha Vornar, Tizia, and Maui began experimenting with the crystal and determined it functioned as a kind of computer interface. Maui discovered that the crystal was using the remains of Cal-Mirrans not only as batteries, but as processing nodes. By swimming into its lower reaches, Maui was able to enter commands directly through the submerged crystal lattice using his tricorder.The result was seismic. The entire city began to rise, the seabed splitting open and revealing a massive geode-like structure beneath it. The crystal dome lifted into the upper atmosphere before losing power. But at that altitude, communications reconnected. The Hudson’s saucer section arrived and locked on with a tractor beam, stabilizing the city in orbit.Meanwhile, the stardrive section of the Hudson, under Commander Jaro, responded to a distress call from the Vinshari system. Racing into a supernova's expanding debris field, they navigated waves of radiation and subspace turbulence to locate survivors.They first recovered Captain J'lara, Thaccin and her crew, then proceeded to rescue multiple Vinshari escape pods. One held a Ha’kiv symbiote suffering from separation withdrawal. In total, they recovered three full crews. A fourth was lost just before the stardrive was forced to retreat.With the shockwave from the supernova closing in, the Hudson’s stardrive section initiated a blind emergency warp jump. They escaped just in time, but arrived somewhere unknown, without contact with the saucer or a clear position in the Expanse.
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-2.sourcePath: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Hudson/Shared/Sessions/Summaries/Season 2/Hudson Log 20.3 - City in the Sky.md

sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-2.title: Hudson Log 21 - Reunions
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-2.description: With the Hudson’s saucer section still stranded without a warp drive in the Seku System, Captain Scriba held a meeting with Noralith and the Seku-4 away team. He asked Noralith what her people wanted now that escape was possible, but she had no clear answer. Asha Vornar escorted her back to quarters, and the crew began scanning for the missing stardrive.On the stardrive, Commander Jaro led engineering efforts while Nisha and Tak worked to locate the saucer. Jolepo and Dr. Delisle checked on the Vinshari passengers and met a woman named VorNo-Se, a member of the Madajah-Ka. She was shaken by the destruction of the Vinshari system and set on bringing justice to Captain J'lara, who she blamed for the genocide. Delisle convinced the Vinshari "engineers" that the Hudson's team could take care of the Ha'kiv and made room for it in a shuttlebay.Both USS Hudson sections worked to re-establish contact by tracking warp trails, triangulating their positions amongst the stars, pinging each other with comms signals.Once reunited, Captain Scriba met with J'lara and the Thaccin. J'lara, devastated by the destruction of her people, agreed to return to Narendra Station. Thaccin engaged in silent telepathic communication with Delisle but refused to share anything about their own species. When Scriba asked again for a DNA sample, Thaccin declined. But they had already left genetic material behind on a teacup.Medical officers treated a number of injured refugees, including Therresa, one of the Akaru from Seku-4. She asked whether she would ever be able to return to Seku-4, which she considered her home. Delisle and Counsellor Valerie helped Therresa admit that there was no going back to Seku-4. In the end Therresa held hope in a future that the Seku-4 colonists could find a new home and bring the Cal-Mirran crystal there with them.Jaro tried to find some peace while working on the nacelles, but was interrupted by a Qofuari named Alando, who mentioned mentioned a Vinshari passenger with strange "stick". Jaro told him to wait until the passenger fell asleep and then steal it.The crew turned their attention to the floating crystal city from Seku-4, hoping it might help locate the Cal-Mirrans. They exposed the crystal to sunlight by removing the walls and ceiling of the temple around it, recharging the crystal. Using previous research by Tizia and Delisle, Jaro completed the translation of the Cal-Mirran interface and sent out a wide, band signal, but received no reply.With no response from the Cal-Mirrans, the Hudson will set course for one final destination: the Candidate-3 System, the last known system sending Tilikaal signals.

sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-2.title: Hudson Log 22 - Candidate Three
sessions/summaries/season-2/hudson-log-2.description: The USS Hudson arrived in orbit over Candidate-3, a planet completely covered in ancient ruins. Sensor scans showed evidence of widespread terraforming. A landed ship near the pyramid turned out to be Akaru in origin, with a few dozen Akaru moving around it—and speaking to a 3-meter-tall robed alien.Before beaming down, Captain Scriba interviewed Noralith and Thaccin to gather intel. Thaccin reported an uncanny sense of belonging, suggesting the planet might be their species’ lost homeworld. Noralith, while unfamiliar with the ruins, recognized the Akaru design and flagged the group as likely religious extremists.The away team had Scriba, Tak, Jaro, Franklin, Delisle, and Jalipo with a security detachment. They beamed into an urban landscape with pentagonal buildings and glowing conduits beneath the streets. These power lines pulsed with energy, all flowing toward the distant pyramid.Immediately, both Delisle and Thaccin began hearing psychic cries: “Help. They’re hurting us. Let us go.” Thaccin, overwhelmed by grief, asked to be transported back to the Hudson, which Scriba approved.Following the energy lines, the team approached the pyramid and observed the Akaru speaking with the strange alien, who telepathically introduced itself as Assessor Tredik. “Welcome. I was not expecting other visitors. May you be more congenial than these.” The Akaru didn’t seem to notice the Starfleet team.However, when a group of Akaru researchers rounded the corner, the team tried to hide. Half managed to dive into a nearby building, which sealed shut behind them, leaving Scriba and Tak behind. The two were captured, interrogated by the Akaru leader (who asked only “What use are you?”), and when Scriba had no answers they liked, they were both locked in the brig of the Akaru ship to be “processed.”Inside the sealed building, Jaro, Jalipo, and Delisle discovered an art gallery filled with sculptures, paintings, and reliefs of various species. Each piece credited its “creator.” One name stood out: Ash-Tamalia, listed as the creator of the Cal-Mirrans.Following the gallery, the team snuck to the ship’s cargo ramp, boarded unseen, and assaulted the brig guards. One guard triggered an alarm before being subdued, prompting a wave of Akaru reinforcements to return to the ship. The Starfleet team fought through the ship’s interior and reached the bridge, but just before they could seize control, the Akaru leader used captain’s override codes to lock the system down.

uss-hudson-b.html.title: USS Hudson-B
uss-hudson-b.html.description:
Summary Location:: The Shackleton Expanse
Portrait:: Note:: The NCC-7832-B: A exploration and diplomatic exchange ship set to explore the Shackleton Expanse.
A Federation Galaxy Class starship commanded by Edward Scriba. Federation Starship Galaxy Class Survivor of Dominion War The USS Hudson-B has been assigned to explore the Shackleton Expanse on the far side of the Klingon and Romulan empires. The Galaxy Class starship has been refit for service as an exploratory vessel after previously serving in the Dominion war. During the refit of the Hudson-B, the previously assumed lost USS Hudson-A reemerged from the Shackleton. Many members of the USS Hudson-A have been reassigned to the Hudson-B. The USS Hudson will be based out of Narendra Station, a deep space research station jointly run by Starfleet and the Klingon Empire.Season 1
Hudson Log 1.1 - Arrival at Bacchus-3: Stardate -, Session: 1The USS Hudson-A arrived at Bacchus-3 and was crippled by subspace distortion waves blocking warp and long-range communication. An away team investigating the source found Federation scientists studying massive monoliths and opened a passage into one of the structures.
Hudson Log 1.2 - Bacchus' Irresistible Call: Stardate -, Session: 2The Hudson’s away team deactivated the subspace distortion from inside one of Bacchus-3’s spires, triggering a catastrophic security response as the planet’s machinery began tearing the system apart. Assisting the crippled Klingon Bird-of-Prey Ya’Leth to jettison its warp core, the crew escaped just before the entire Bacchus system collapsed into a singularity and vanished.
Hudson Log 2 - Orion Heist: Stardate -, Session: 3Admiral Banna Stoker sent the crew of the USS Hudson to recover a stolen Tilikaal artifact. The crew tracked the artifact down to the SS Tardigrade, an Orion trade ship, and convinced them to hand over the artifact before their Romulan liaison arrived. Back on Narendra Station, Admiral Stoker took the artifact to study further.
Hudson Log 3 - Phantoms Adrift: Stardate -, Session: 4While delivering a message to Captain Skaarsen, Commander Lodge and Lt. Tiaun discovered a 50-year-old derelict Starfleet ship drifting in an ion nebula. Inside, an unknown species attempted to impersonate them, but the real officers escaped and completed their mission, leaving Starfleet to investigate the anomaly.
Hudson Log 4.1 - The Pasqual Problem: Stardate -, Session: 5While preparing for a deep space scan, the Hudson was redirected by Admiral Stoker to the uncharted Pasqual system. An away team surveyed the primitive yet diverse inhabitants of Pasqual-1 without making contact, returning with film and observational data after 24 hours.
Hudson Log 4.2 - The Pasqual Problem: Stardate -, Session: 6The Hudson disabled a hostile Klingon D7 cruiser demanding Admiral Stoker's surrender, with Lodge and Suvok gaining access to tend to the wounded under the guise of ensuring honorable combat. Meanwhile, Jolepo and Verid refitted a probe to penetrate Pasqual-1's EM field, retrieving millennia of genetic survey data linked to mysterious "genetic advancement attempts."
Hudson Log 5 - Aboard the Klingon Ship: Stardate -, Session: 7Suvok, Lodge, Valerie, and Tak boarded the IKR Ya'leth under the guise of providing medical aid, but quickly uncovered that both the Klingon captain and Admiral Stoker were secretly pursuing a powerful weapon. As the Klingon crew mutinied, the Hudson team returned to confront Stoker, who ordered the Klingon ship destroyed. Captain Alder to have her arrested.
Hudson Log 6 - Border Dispute: Stardate -, Session: 8The USS Hudson responded to a distress call from the USS Nightingale, finding it stranded in the Neutral Zone and its crew claimed by a Romulan warbird. During the rescue, a disguised Romulan agent named T'lek attempted to flee but was captured aboard the Hudson; their exact objective remains unknown.
Hudson Log 7 - Investigation: Stardate -, Session: 9While the Hudson was docked for Admiral Stoker’s court martial, the crew investigated the Tilikaal artifact’s influence and uncovered a subliminal mind-control signal embedded in its subspace transmission. At the same time, Commander Lodge pursued black market Tilikaal leads and reopened civilian access to restricted systems.
Hudson Log 8 - Court Martial: Stardate -, Session: 10Admiral Banna Stoker was put on trial for a court martial. Commander Robert H. Lodge lead the prosecution on the request of Captain Alder. Defense Attorney Samuel T Cogley. The tribunal ruled to acquit Stoker of charges, but reassigned her to a position far away from the Shackleton Expanse where her condition can be monitored.
Hudson Log 9 - Convention: Stardate -, Session: 11Kassandra Pruitt vanished while investigating Romulan-linked data, prompting Starfleet to host a convention as a trap. The Hudson crew uncovered a Tilikaal dagger, and Sukav was taken into Romulan space after baiting a deal with Subcommander Thal’vaek.
Hudson Log 10.1 - Abyss Station: Stardate -, Session: 12Attempting to rescue Sukav, the Hudson chased a Romulan bird of prey to a black hole with a neutronium lined space station and a singular rocky planet orbiting it. The planet had strange cultist gazing at the black hole waiting for the day it would "gaze back". The black hole was rotating to annihilate the planet with its radiation jets. On the strange alien station, an away team tried to rescue Sukav.
Hudson Log 10.2 - Abyss Station Part 2: Stardate -, Session: 13Verid and Sukav made the ultimate sacrifice to destroy Abyss Station, so that no one can use it again. On the planet, Nisha and Tak left the cultists on the service, unable to break them from their faith. Season 2
Hudson Log 11 - Crystal Clear: Stardate 56030, Session 14The Hudson encountered a strange crystalline starship, and attempted to remove a torpedo from it, but ended up causes more damage. When they returned to Narendra Station, they found over 100 years had passed during their time at the black hole. Several members decide to either leave Starfleet or transfer to new positions. They rest of the long lost crew of the Hudson would continue their adventures in the Shackleton Expanse.
Hudson Log 12 - Pasqual's Progress: Stardate 56052, Session 15Captain Edward Scriba took several members of the new USS Hudson-B on a short survey mission aboard the Hudson's yacht. They visited Pasqual-1, and found the society there advancing rapidly though technological ages on their own. The people of Pasqual had embark on a century long project to go to space. An away team found a single neutronium obelisk left on the planet, which seemed to have some sort of influence on the people there.
Hudson Log 13.1 - Pasqual's Past: Stardate 56073, Session 16Admiral Hebert gave Captain Scriba permission to make first contact with the people of Pasqual-1. There, the Pasqualese were in a frenzy trying to learn as much about Starfleet technology as possible. But in their extended visit, Jaro found a dark secret buried beneath the repository: A borg queen.
Hudson Log 13.2 - The Proto-Borg: Stardate 56091, Session 17The crew of the Hudson learned that the org believed itself to be a creation of the Tilikaal. Thinking the Borg was too much of a threat, the crew killed the "Borg queen" and calledi n the Federation, who occupied the planet briefly to remove all possible borg and Tilikaal influence on the planet.
Hudson Log 14 - The Qofuari Conundrum: Stardate 56107, Session 18The Hudson responded to a distress call from a population of futurists on a planet where advanced technology was illegal to develop. After deliberating over the demands of the Prime Directive, the Hudson took many of the futurists aboard to bring back to Narendra Station
Hudson Log 15 - Fading Sun: Stardate 56127, Session 19The Hudson visited the starbase Epsilon 19, where energy parasites from a nearby star had caused several major explosions. The crew managed to restore power and capture or kill the parasites. An Orion woman named Helestia was arrested for stealing scientific equipment in the confusion.
Hudson Log 16.1 - Convoy SE-119: Stardate 56168, Session 20The Hudson and Klingon ship Mupwl' escorted a convoy to a new colony location in the Shackleton Expanse. Along the way, the Mupwl' was disabled by subspace eddies and the convoy attacked by pirated calling themselves "Vinshari"
Hudson Log 16.2 - Prisoner: Stardate 56168, Session 21The Hudson scared off the attack Vinshari pirates, and took aboard 1 surviving prisoner named MianNo-Ar. The Hudson learned about MianNo-Ar's bio-electric warp technology, a little bit of his people's political structure, and repaired his ship. They sent MianNo-Ar home on the repaired ship with a message of peace.
Hudson Log 17.1 - Decision Point: Stardate 56185, Session 22The USS Hudson responded to mysterious signals emanating from the Shackleton Expanse, tracing them to the Orgun system—where unstable tectonics were tearing a pre‑warp planet apart. An away team discovered malfunctioning Tilikaal terraformers deep underground that were causing the geological havoc, and managed to shut them down to buy precious additional time for evacuation. Though the immediate crisis was halted, the planet still faces long-term climate collapse and the natives must be relocated.
Hudson Log 17.2 - No Place Like Home: Stardate 56185, Session 23The USS Hudson coordinated the evacuation of Orgun III after halting a Tilikaal-induced planetary collapse, debating relocation options under the Prime Directive. The crew settled on a nearby Type K planet as a temporary refuge while engineering teams used Tilikaal technology to adjust Orgun III’s orbit and begin atmospheric repairs. The refugees now have a stable home until their planet becomes habitable again.
Hudson Log 18 - Life and Soul: Stardate 56201, Session 24-
Hudson Log 19 - New Life and New Civilizations: Stardate 56265, Session 25The USS Hudson discovered massive lifeforms called Ha’kiv being hunted by Vinshari ships as living energy sources and was forced to retreat after sustaining heavy damage in battle. Pursued by the Ar-Ka-Se, a Vinshari splinter group, the crew learned from Captain J’Lara and her Tilikaal science officer Thacinn that the Ha’kiv were being driven to extinction. Unable to assist directly, the Hudson offered technical support as J’Lara prepared to attempt the rescue on her own.
Hudson Log 20.1 - Signals: Stardate 56282, Session 26The USS Hudson investigated a subspace signal near the Seku system, where the crew crash-landed on an ocean planet and discovered a hidden crystalline city beneath the waves. Inside, they met survivors from several species and encountered a massive Tilikaal crystal generating an energy dome that held back the sea.
Hudson Log 20.2 - Atlantis: Stardate 56282, Session 27The Hudson’s away team continued exploring the underwater settlement on Seku IV and worked to modify a submersible shuttle for long-range communications. There, they further uncovered the mystery of who built this city and why.
Hudson Log 20.3 - City in the Sky: Stardate 56282, Session 28After Maui’s rescue, the team used the Cal-Mirran crystal on Seku-4 to raise the submerged city into the upper atmosphere, where the Hudson’s saucer section stabilized it in orbit. Meanwhile, Commander Jaro’s stardrive section rescued several Vinshari crews from a supernova zone but was forced to blind-warp away, vanishing without contact.
Hudson Log 21 - Reunions: Stardate 56298, Session 29The saucer and stardrive sections of the Hudson were finally reunited, and the crew began processing the fallout of Seku IV and the destruction of the Vinshari home system. The crew of the Hudson consoled the refugees and decided to keep them all on board until they returned to Narendra Station.
Hudson Log 22 - Candidate Three: Stardate 56379, Session 30In orbit of Candidate-3, the Hudson found the planet entirely covered in ancient alien ruins, possibly the origin world of Thaccin. The away team encountered a group of Akaru zealots investigating a strange pyramid and an alien hologram calling itself Assessor Tredik, but things quickly went sideways when half the team was captured and locked aboard the Akaru vessel. After a rescue attempt, the away team was nearly successful in taking the bridge, but were thwarted when the Akaru commander used override codes to lock them out. The Hudson is equipped with dozens of shuttles. Some notable ones are listed below!

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar
